sen.j: 佐久間 勉（さくま つとむ、9月13日 - 4月15日）は、日本の大日本帝国海軍軍人。
sen.e: Tsutomu SAKUMA (September 13, 1879 - April 15, 1910) was a naval officer of the Imperial Japanese Navy.
sen.cmt: この佐久間勉に関する記事ですが、原文にまったく年号が出てきません。生年・没年月日にも何年かが書かれていません。wikipediaには出ていますので、英訳では年月日を付加しています。
sen.e: Tsutomu SAKUMA (September 13, 1879 - April 15, 1910) was a naval officer of the Imperial Japanese Navy.
Tsutomu SAKUMA (September 13, 1879 - April 15, 1910) was a naval officer of the Imperial Japanese Navy.
His final rank in the Imperial Japanese Navy was Lieutenant.
His final rank in the Imperial Japanese Navy was daijo (Senior Lieutenant).

sen.e: His final rank in the Imperial Japanese Navy was daijo (Senior Lieutenant).

sen.j: 福井県三方郡八村（現、若狭町）で前川神社神官・小学校教員、佐久間可盛の二男として生まれる。
sen.e: He was born in Hachi Village, Mikata District, Fukui Prefecture (currently it is Wakasa-cho) as the second son of Yoshimori SAKUMA, who was the Shinto priest of Maekawa Shrine and also the teacher of an elementary school.

He was born in Hachi Village, Mikata County, Fukui Prefecture (currently it is Wakasa-cho) as the second son of Yoshimori SAKUMA, who was the Shinto priest of Maekawa-jinja Shrine and also the teacher of an elementary school.
sen.cmt: ・郡はCountyに直しました。・前川神社の表記については、仕様指示書を参考に修正しました。
sen.e: He was born in Hachi Village, Mikata County, Fukui Prefecture (currently it is Wakasa-cho) as the second son of Yoshimori SAKUMA, who was the Shinto priest of Maekawa-jinja Shrine and also the teacher of an elementary school.

sen.j: 福井県立若狭高等学校、攻玉社中学校・高等学校を経て、12月、海軍兵学校 (日本)（29期）を卒業。
sen.e: He went through general studies in Fukui Prefectural Obama Middle School, Kogyokusha Middle School/High School, then he studied at the Imperial Japanese Naval Academy and graduated as the 29th graduate bodies in December 1901,.
sen.cmt: この項目ですが、wikipediaのページ内容と異なっています。wikipediaでは若狭高等学校ではなく、福井県立小浜尋常中学とあります。このエクセルの原文を見ても、福井県立若狭「高等学校」から始まり、次に攻玉社「中学・高校」とあり、不自然なのが分かります。そのなるためwikipediaページを正とし、訂正訳しました。
sen.e: He went through general studies in Fukui Prefectural Obama Middle School, Kogyokusha Middle School/High School, then he studied at the Imperial Japanese Naval Academy and graduated as the 29th graduate bodies in December 1901,.

He went through general studies in Fukui Prefectural Obama Middle School, Kogyokusha Middle School/High School, then he studied at the Imperial Japanese Naval Academy and graduated as the 29th graduate bodies in December 1901,.

sen.j: 後年内閣総理大臣を務めた米内光政は兵学校の同期生。
sen.e: Mitsumasa YONAI, who became the prime minister of Japan, was the graduate of the Naval Academy of the same year with SAKUMA.
Mitsumasa YONAI, who became the prime minister of Japan, was the graduate of the Naval Academy of the same year with SAKUMA.

sen.j: 、海軍少尉に任官、巡洋艦「吾妻 (装甲巡洋艦)」に乗り組み日露戦争を迎えた。
sen.e: In 1903, he was appointed as an Ensign of the Imperial Japanese Navy to serve on Cruiser "Agatsuma," (the armored cruiser class) and he reached the end of the Japanese-Russo War in the position.
sen.cmt: この項目も元wikipediaページにある年号が削除され、句読点から始まるおかしな形になっています。
sen.e: In 1903, he was appointed as an second lieutenant of navy and when serving on Cruiser "Azuma," (the armored cruiser class), he experienced the Japanese-Russo War.
sen.cmt: ・ウィキペディアの「佐久間勉」の該当箇所を確認いたしました。年号等は間違いありません。・「海軍少尉」は用語集の用語検索を参考に修正しました。・「吾妻」はウィキペディアによると「あづま」です。http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%90%BE%E5%A6%BB_(%E8%A3%85%E7%94%B2%E5%B7%A1%E6%B4%8B%E8%89%A6)・「～に乗り込み日露戦争を迎えた」の英訳部分が原文と合わないようなので、修正し「～に乗り込んだ時、日露戦争を経験した」と解釈して訳しなおしました。
sen.e: In 1903, he was appointed as an second lieutenant of navy and when serving on Cruiser "Azuma," (the armored cruiser class), he experienced the Japanese-Russo War.

sen.j: 日本海海戦時には巡洋艦「笠置 (巡洋艦)」に乗り組んでいた。
sen.e: However, he was on board of Cruiser "Kasagi" (the normal cruiser class) during the Nihonkai Kaisen (the Naval battle of Japan Sea) of the Japanese-Russo War.
He was on board of Cruiser "Kasagi" (the normal cruiser class) during the Battle of Tsushima.
sen.cmt: ・Howeverは原文にないので削除しました。・日本海海戦は用語集の用語検索を参考に修正しました。
sen.e: He was on board of Cruiser "Kasagi" (the normal cruiser class) during the Battle of Tsushima.

sen.j: 戦後、海軍水雷学校学生、水雷母艦「韓崎 (潜水母艦)」で勤務。
sen.e: After the war, he became the student of the Imperial Japanese Naval Academy department of torpedo and mine arts, and then he served on the torpedo and mine mother ship "Kanzaki." (the mother ship of submarine)
After the war, he became the student of the Imperial Japanese Naval Academy department of torpedo and mine arts, and then he served on the torpedo and mine carrier, "Karasaki." (submarine carrier)
sen.cmt: ・ウィキペディアによると韓崎は「からさき」と読みます。http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E9%9F%93%E5%B4%8E_(%E6%BD%9C%E6%B0%B4%E6%AF%8D%E8%89%A6)・「母艦」の訳を辞書と用語検索を参考に、変更しました。
sen.e: After the war, he became the student of the Imperial Japanese Naval Academy department of torpedo and mine arts, and then he served on the torpedo and mine carrier, "Karasaki." (submarine carrier)

sen.j: さらに、第1潜水艇隊艇長、第4号潜水艇長、第一艦隊 (日本海軍)参謀、駆逐艦「春風（初代）」艦長、巡洋艦「対馬 (防護巡洋艦)」分隊長を歴任。
sen.e: He successively held the following posts; the commander of the 1st Submarine Squadron and the captain of the No.4 Submarine of this squadron; the staff officer of the Imperial Japanese Naval 1st Fleet; the captain of Destroyer "Harukaze," (the first generation type) the division officer on Cruiser "Tsushima." (the protective cruiser class)

(the protective cruiser class)

sen.j: 11月、第六潜水艇隊艇長を命ぜられた。
sen.e: In November 1908, SAKUMA was appointed as the commander of the type 6th Submarine Squadron.
In November 1908, SAKUMA was appointed as the commander of the type 6th Submarine Squadron.

sen.j: 4月15日、第六潜水艇は山口県新湊沖で半潜航訓練中に沈没、佐久間以下14名が殉職した。
sen.e: On April 15 of the same year, his type 6th submarine sank during the halfway submerging drill at the offshore of Shinminato City, Yamaguchi Prefecture, (currently it is Imizu City) and 14 officers on board, from the captain SAKUMA and down died on duty.

On April 15 of the same year, his type 6th submarine sank during the halfway submerging drill at the offshore of Shinminato, Yamaguchi Prefecture, and 14 officers on board, including the captain SAKUMA, died on duty.
sen.cmt: ・(currently it is Imizu City)は原文にないので削除しました。・「佐久間以下」とは「佐久間を含め」と解釈し、表現を修正しました。
sen.e: On April 15 of the same year, his type 6th submarine sank during the halfway submerging drill at the offshore of Shinminato, Yamaguchi Prefecture, and 14 officers on board, including the captain SAKUMA, died on duty.

sen.j: 4月17日に第六潜水艇が引き揚げられ、佐久間の遺書が発見された。
sen.e: On April 17, the sunken type 6th submarine was salvaged, and the note of Sakuma written before the death was found.
On April 17, the submarine was salvaged, and the note written by Sakuma before the death was found.
sen.cmt: ・第六潜水艇は上記にも出てくるので、冗長さをなくすためthe submarineとだけにしました。
sen.e: On April 17, the submarine was salvaged, and the note written by Sakuma before the death was found.

sen.j: 4月20日、その内容が発表され大きな反響を呼び、同日、殉職者14名の海軍公葬が呉市海軍基地で行われた。
sen.e: On April 20, the contents of the note was published and it stirred a great sensation; the official funeral service of Imperial Navy was held for those 14 victims of the naval duty, at the naval base of Kure City, Hiroshima Prefecture.

On April 20, the contents of the note was published and it created great sensation; the official funeral service of Imperial Navy was held for those 14 victims of the naval duty, at the naval base of Kure City, Hiroshima Prefecture.

sen.e: On April 20, the contents of the note was published and it created great sensation; the official funeral service of Imperial Navy was held for those 14 victims of the naval duty, at the naval base of Kure City, Hiroshima Prefecture.

sen.j: 同年4月26日に佐久間の葬儀が、郷里の前川神社で村葬として執行された。
sen.e: On April 26, the funeral of SAKUMA was held as the official village funeral service at Maekawa Shrine in his hometown.
